intro: Hippocratea myriantha, commonly known as the pink-flowered tree, is a species of flowering plant native to the tropical regions of South America. It belongs to the Fabaceae family, which includes legumes, and is characterized by its compound leaves and showy, pink or purple flowers. The plant is typically a small to medium-sized tree or shrub, often found in moist, well-drained soils in forested areas. Its flowers are clustered in inflorescences and attract various pollinators, contributing to its ecological significance in its native habitat.
